title: Odin Bailey the hero as Birmingham City snatch dramatic late victory over Middlesbrough
text:
Birmingham City 2 Middlesbrough 1

Birmingham City halted a run of three straight defeats, grabbing the winning goal in the 90th minute after Jonathan Woodgate’s side had snatched what looked like an equaliser two minutes earlier.

A goal by their 21-year-old Spanish midfielder Fran Villalba after 33 minutes had been enough to give them the edge in a match they had largely controlled, only for Daniel Ayala to bundle the ball over the line and seemingly steal a point for Middlesbrough.

But then a header by 19-year-old substitute Odin Bailey, like Villalba scoring his first Birmingham goal in a team full of youthful potential, restored their advantage and secured the three points their performance deserved.

“It is very pleasing to see the younger players contribute like that,” head coach Pep Clotet said afterwards. “We want to give them the chance to show their talent. They represent the future of the club.

“I think this was our best performance since I came here. We stuck to our philosophy and we were able to combine the performance that we want with the result that we want.”
